citation.title: Revealing glacier flow and surge dynamics from animated satellite image sequences: examples from the Karakoram

news.title: Timelapse from space reveals glacier in motion
news.summary: Animations that compress 25 years of satellite images into just one second reveal the complex behaviour and flow of glaciers in the Karakoram mountain range in Asia.

news.title: New Animated Images Reveal How Glaciers Flow
news.summary: How do glaciers flow? Scientists are getting a closer look thanks to animated satellite images.

news.title: Revealing Glacier Flow with Animated Satellite Images
news.summary: Frank Paul, a glaciologist at the University of Zurich in Switzerland, has created animations from satellite images of the Karakoram mountain range in Asia to show how its glaciers flow and change.

news.title: Animated Satellite Images Reveal Glaciers in Motion
news.summary: Animations that compress more than two decades of satellite images into one second reveal the complex behavior and flow of glaciers in the Karakoram mountain range in Asia.

news.title: Revealing glacier flow with animated satellite images
news.summary: Home Earth Earth Sciences November 26, 2015 November 26, 2015 Frank Paul, a glaciologist at the University of Zurich in Switzerland, has created animations from satellite images of the Karakoram mountain range in Asia to show how its glaciers flow…

news.title: Timelapse filmed from SPACE show glaciers flowing over decades
news.summary: Animations show glacier movements accelerated by 800 million times Satellite images taken over 25 years were combined to create time-lapses Many glaciers in the Karakoram range are actually increasing in size Curious 'surge' behaviour makes them…

news.title: Watch 25 Years of Glacier Movement in Under a Second
news.summary: Ever wondered just how much glaciers move over the decades? Well, this gid shows 25 years of motion of glaciers on the Karakoram mountain range of Asia in just 0.7 seconds.

news.title: Animated Satellite Images Show 25 Years Of Glacier Movement In One Second
news.summary: Compiled satellite images show that glaciers in Karakoram mountain range are advancing instead of retreating.

news.title: Karakorum glaciers: 25 years in one second
news.summary: Posted November 27, 2015 12:16:10 New animations show the ebb and flow of glaciers in Asia's Karakorum mountain range over the past quarter of a century.

news.title: Animated Satellite Images Reveal Glaciers in Motion
news.summary: Animations that compress more than two decades of satellite images into one second reveal the complex behavior and flow of glaciers in the Karakoram mountain range in Asia.

blogs.title: Animation: Satellite images of ‘surging’ glaciers in Asia
blogs.summary:
A new study has created a series of animations that capture ‘surging’ glaciers in the Karakoram mountain range in Asia over 25 years, from 1990 to 2015.

blogs.title: ESA animations show 25 years of glacier movement in a single second

facebook.summary:
Press Release: Revealing glacier flow with animated satellite images.

Frank Paul, a glaciologist at the University of Zurich in Switzerland, has created animations from satellite images of the Karakoram mountain range in Asia to show how its glaciers flow
